org.modelio.api.diagram

Interface IDiagramGraphic

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IDiagramDG, IDiagramDrawing, IDiagramDrawingsLayer, IDiagramElementsLayer, IDiagramLayer, IDiagramLink, IDiagramNode

    public interface IDiagramGraphic

    Base interface of all graphical elements.

    A IDiagramGraphic may be a node (IDiagramNode) or a link (IDiagramLink).

    A graphic element may be related to an MObject model. The element might not exist any longer (IDiagramGraphic#getElement returns null), meaning the graphical element is a "ghost". Therefore, the only information still available are the Name of the ghost element, and its MRef.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      MObject getElement()
      Get the element this IDiagramGraphic is related to.
      List<IDiagramLink> getFromLinks()
      Return the links that are starting (ie outgoing links) from this node.
      MObject getHyperLink()
      For graphics that may have an hyper link to a model object, get the linked object.
      IDiagramLayer getLayer()
      Get the layer this graphic belongs to.
      List<String> getLocalPropertyNames()
      Get the list of all properties which values have been changed from their default "style" value.
      String getName()
      Return the name of this graphic.
      String getProperty(String property)
      Get a style property.
      The resolution of the property values follows this algorithm:
      return the local redefinition of the property if it exists. otherwise, go to the graphical owner and return its local redefinition of the property if it exists. when no local redefinition is found, the default value comes from the style of the element. when no style value is found, the extended style are checked. lastly, if no style defines a value, Modelio gives a default "factory value".
      Might return null if the corresponding style key isn't defined.
      IStyleHandle getStyle()
      Get the graphical element style.
      List<IDiagramLink> getToLinks()
      Return the links that are ending (ie incoming links) at this node.
      boolean isPrimarySelected()
      Returns the selected state of this graphical element.
      boolean isSelected()
      Returns the selected state of this graphical element.
      void mask()
      Mask the current representation.
      void moveToLayer(IDiagramLayer newLayer)
      Move the graphic to another layer.
      void normalizeLocalProperties()
      Normalizing an element's style consists in removing from its local definitions the values that are currently the same as the value in cascaded style.
      void resetLocalProperties()
      Removes all local property redefinitions.
      void setHyperLink(MObject obj)
      For graphics that may have an hyper link to a model object, set the linked object.
      void setProperty(String property, String value)
      Sets the local property value of this graphic element for 'property'.
      void setStyle(IStyleHandle style)
      Set the style used to get a property value when it is not defined locally.

    • Method Detail

      • getElement

        MObject getElement()
        Get the element this IDiagramGraphic is related to.

        Note: May return null if the element is not resolved. or the graphic does not represent a model element, such as diagram drawings..

        Returns:
        the represented element or null if the element is not resolved.

      • getFromLinks

        List<IDiagramLink> getFromLinks()
        Return the links that are starting (ie outgoing links) from this node.
        Returns:
        A list of links in any case, possibly an empty one. Never returns null

      • getHyperLink

        MObject getHyperLink()
        For graphics that may have an hyper link to a model object, get the linked object.

        Returns null for graphics that cannot have hyper-link to a model object.

        Returns:
        the linked model object or null.
        Since:
        3.1

      • getLayer

        IDiagramLayer getLayer()
        Get the layer this graphic belongs to.
        Returns:
        the layer.
        Since:
        3.1

      • getLocalPropertyNames

        List<String> getLocalPropertyNames()
        Get the list of all properties which values have been changed from their default "style" value.
        Returns:
        A list of property names. It might be empty, but not null.

      • getName

        String getName()
        Return the name of this graphic. In most cases the name is the displayed label but this can however vary for different elements. No uniqueness of names across a diagram should be assumed.
        For "ghost" graphics, the name should be the last know label.
        Returns:
        the node name
        Since:
        2.1

      • getProperty

        String getProperty(String property)
        Get a style property.
        The resolution of the property values follows this algorithm:
      • return the local redefinition of the property if it exists.
      • otherwise, go to the graphical owner and return its local redefinition of the property if it exists.
      • when no local redefinition is found, the default value comes from the style of the element.
      • when no style value is found, the extended style are checked.
      • lastly, if no style defines a value, Modelio gives a default "factory value".

        • Might return null if the corresponding style key isn't defined.
Parameters:
property - The property name
Returns:
The property value

  • getStyle

    IStyleHandle getStyle()
    Get the graphical element style.

    The style contains many properties such has the foreground and background color, the font and some display options. These properties are displayed and editable in the symbol view.

    Returns:
    the graphical element style.

  • getToLinks

    List<IDiagramLink> getToLinks()
    Return the links that are ending (ie incoming links) at this node.
    Returns:
    A list of links in any case, possibly an empty one. Never returns null

  • isPrimarySelected

    boolean isPrimarySelected()
    Returns the selected state of this graphical element.
    Returns:
    true if the graphical element is the primary selection of the diagram.

  • isSelected

    boolean isSelected()
    Returns the selected state of this graphical element.
    Returns:
    true if the graphical element is selected in the diagram.

  • mask

    void mask()
    Mask the current representation. The associated element is not removed from the model.

  • moveToLayer

    void moveToLayer(IDiagramLayer newLayer)
                 throws IllegalArgumentException
    Move the graphic to another layer.

    The new layer must be compatible with the old one.

    Parameters:
    newLayer - the new layer
    Throws:
    IllegalArgumentException - if the new layer is not compatible with the graphic.

  • normalizeLocalProperties

    void normalizeLocalProperties()
    Normalizing an element's style consists in removing from its local definitions the values that are currently the same as the value in cascaded style.
    Since:
    2.1.1

  • resetLocalProperties

    void resetLocalProperties()
    Removes all local property redefinitions. Does not modify the cascaded style.
    Since:
    2.1.1

  • setHyperLink

    void setHyperLink(MObject obj)
    For graphics that may have an hyper link to a model object, set the linked object.

    Has no effect on a graphic that cannot have hyper-link to a model object.

    Parameters:
    obj - the linked model object or null.
    Since:
    3.1

  • setProperty

    void setProperty(String property,
               String value)
    Sets the local property value of this graphic element for 'property'.
    Parameters:
    property - The property name
    value - The property value

  • setStyle

    void setStyle(IStyleHandle style)
    Set the style used to get a property value when it is not defined locally.
    Parameters:
    style - The new style.
